page.title: 10Farming around Snape, Yorks.
page.content: Snape village is in the centre of a region of mixed farming.There are 16 farms, just over half keeping some cows and fattening beast for market.Sheep are kept on 12 farms.Pigs are kept on smallholdings in the village.Barley is the main crop, with oil-seed rape and wheat not grown as extensively as in previous years. {East End Farm.} My name is James,I am 10 years old and I live on a farm in the village.We are growing a fairly new crop called typhon, which is a cross between a cabbage and a turnip.We milk about 27 cows, also we have some beast which we are fattening for market, and heifers of which the Friesians are kept for milking and the others go to market.We have a sheepdog called Shep and we grow hay to feed the cattle in winter.
